title: ICE'd during const eval of generic with DST

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Reproducible in the playground: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a7e62bb084b21bc2081c79e320c740a0 ### Code ```Rust #![feature(const_evaluatable_checked)] #![feature(const_generics)] use core::fmt::Debug; use core::marker::PhantomData; struct Inline where [u8; ::core::mem::size_of::() + 1]: { _phantom: PhantomData, buf: [u8; ::core::mem::size_of::() + 1] } impl Inline where [u8; ::core::mem::size_of::() + 1]: { pub fn new(val: T) -> Inline { todo!() } } fn main() { // let dst = Inline::::new(0); OK let dst = Inline::::new(0); // BANG! } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.51.0-nightly (61f5a0092 2021-01-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: 61f5a0092364061ec5649ca98d5e3e9b927880fe commit-date: 2021-01-04 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.51.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling icey v0.1.0 (/tmp/icey) warning: the feature `const_evaluatable_checked` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> src/main.rs:1:12 | 1 | #![feature(const_evaluatable_checked)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default = note: see issue #76560 for more information warning: the feature `const_generics` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> src/main.rs:2:12 | 2 | #![feature(const_generics)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #44580 for more information thread 'rustc' panicked at 'SizeOf nullary MIR operator called for unsized type', compiler/rustc_mir/src/interpret/step.rs:267:17 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.51.0-nightly (61f5a0092 2021-01-04) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `Inline::::{constant#0}` #1 [eval_to_const_value_raw] simplifying constant for the type system `Inline::::{constant#0}` end of query stack warning: 2 warnings emitted error: could not compile `icey` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

#![feature(const_evaluatable_checked)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default = note: see issue #76560 for more information warning: the feature `const_generics` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> src/main.rs:2:12 | 2 | #![feature(const_generics)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #44580 for more information thread 'rustc' panicked at 'SizeOf nullary MIR operator called for unsized type', compiler/rustc_mir/src/interpret/step.rs:267:17 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: const-evaluating + checking `Inline::::{constant#0}` #1 [eval_to_const_value_raw] simplifying constant for the type system `Inline::::{constant#0}` #2 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `the constant `Inline::::{constant#0}` can be evaluated` #3 [typeck] type-checking `main` #4 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #5 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack warning: 2 warnings emitted error: could not compile `icey` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
